Translated by AmoghavajrağŸ”½At that time, Bodhisattva Samantabhadra
observed humans and gods, and out of compassion for all, he spoke without interruption:
All sentient beings' four great elements change from afar,
giving rise to various illnesses, or ghosts and demons come to cause various illnesses.
They confuse the world and reduce life spans.
How does one counteract these various internal and external harms?
It is said that sentient beings do not know gratitude,
and thus there are such conflicts. What is gratitude?
It refers to earth, water, fire, and wind.
The sun, moon, and gods all have the kindness of nurturing internally and externally.
How can one repay such kindness?
It is said that the four great elements have their essence,
as do the gods, sun, moon, and so forth.
Worshiping these gods has various benefits,
enhancing the power of both the vessel realm and the living beings realm.
For whom is this?
How many are there?
Namely, there are twelve such gods.
Earth gods, water gods, fire gods, wind gods, Ishana gods, Shakra gods, Yama gods, Brahma gods, Vaishravana gods, rakshasa gods, sun gods, and moon gods.
When the earth god is pleased, there are two benefits.
First, the human body becomes firm and color and strength increase.
Second, the flavors and powers of the earth element in the world increase.
When this god is angry, there are also two harms.
First, the human body becomes disordered, and color and strength decrease.
Second, the flavors and powers of the earth element in the world all go against the original.
When the water god is pleased, there are two benefits.
First, the human body is not thirsty.
Second, the rain and moisture are timely.
When this god is angry, there are also two harms.
First, the human body becomes dry and thirsty.
Second, in the world, there is drought and all things dry up.
Or it rains heavily, filling the world with water, damaging the grass and not reaching the beings.
When the fire god is pleased, there are two benefits.
First, the heat in the human body increases and decreases according to the season.
Second, the seasons do not go against it. When this deity is angry, there are also two losses.
First, the heat in the human body increases and decreases at the wrong time.
Second, spontaneous fires burn various objects.
When the wind deity is delighted, there are two benefits.
First, the human body is light and comfortable, and movement follows one's intention.
Second, the vessel realm is peaceful and stable, without any tilting or shaking.
Yet in the world, there are cold winds that are harmonious and do not harm sentient beings or non-sentient beings.
When this deity is angry, there are also two losses.
First, the human body and voice do not follow one's intention.
Second, a great wind blows and scatters and destroys the world.
Or if the wind does not blow, plants and trees do not follow the season.
If there are such four great elements,
when the deities are angry and difficult, the king and the people
should enter the five-wheel pagoda of the TathÄgata.
Uphold the precepts and take refuge in the Three Jewels.
Concentrate the mind and abide, and should contemplate like this.
Earth arises based on water, and since the nature of water is empty, earth is also impermanent.
Water arises based on wind, and since the nature of wind is empty, water is also impermanent.
Fire arises based on water and wind, and since water and wind are empty, fire is also impermanent.
Wind arises based on space, and since space has no substance, wind is also impermanent.
Since wind is empty, fire is empty.
Since fire is empty, water is empty.
Since water is empty, earth is empty.
Since earth is empty, all sentient and insentient beings born on the earth are also impermanent.
When contemplating in this way,
the anger of the devas ceases and they have no place to abide.
At that time, the practitioner again contemplates:
Although space is non-existent, there is still space.
Therefore, it is called space.
A name must have a substance.
The reason why space exists is that wind also exists.
Since wind exists, fire, water, earth, and so forth all have substance.
When contemplating in this way, the devas rejoice.
Their majestic radiance doubles and they abide in peace.
When the god Isana is pleased, the other gods are also pleased.
The demon hordes are not disturbed.
The old name is Mahesvara.
The Buddha said, If one makes offerings to Mahesvara, it is already making offerings to all the gods.
When this god is angry, the demon hordes all appear and the country becomes chaotic.
The Heavenly Emperor is the lord of the earth-dwelling beings.
He records the good and evil deeds of sentient beings.
When this god is pleased, the country is peaceful and the people are not disturbed.
When this god is angry, there are wars with weapons.
The kings of the earth-dwelling realms are all at ease.
When the god Yama is pleased, people do not die unexpectedly and epidemics do not occur.
When this god is angry, people die untimely and epidemics fill the land.
Brahma Heaven is the lord of the higher heavens and the father of sentient beings.
When this god is pleased, the world of vessels is peaceful and there is no disturbance.
Why is this?
At the beginning of the eon,
this god established the world of vessels.
Sentient beings are not confused, and the world is governed righteously.
Why is this so?
Because the father king is delighted.
When this god is angry,
the world is uneasy and there are various illnesses.

At what time do these gods rejoice and at what time do they become angry?
It means that the kings and people of various countries
govern the world improperly and do unwholesome actions.
They constantly engage in killing and stealing and abandon the true Dharma.
At that time, the gods all become sorrowful.
Sorrowfulness passes and then they give rise to anger.
If a heavenly calamity is about to occur, there will first be strange omens.
It means raining without clouds.
The stars are chaotic and it rains without clouds.
This is the tears of the gods weeping. If they stop unwholesome actions
and govern the world properly, the gods will rejoice.
All come to protect, with wonderful incense pervading everywhere.
Good increases, evil diminishes.
If a person thoroughly understands the majestic virtue of such great sages and gods,
They make offerings with wealth to adorn their physical bodies.
Later, with the offering of the Dharma, they manifest their Dharma body.
In addition, they practice compassion and do not take life.
This is making offerings to repay their kindness.
There are a great many gods and spirits in the world.
Why only make offerings to these twelve gods?
Establishing the country, the myriad people are at peace and happy.
It is said that the twelve gods collectively encompass all the gods, dragons, spirits, stars, and underworld officials.
Therefore, by making offerings to these twelve gods,
One will attain the protection of all the gods, dragons, and others.
The reason for this is that the earth god and the various spirits on the ground, the ghosts and spirits under the trees and in the wilderness,
All come to enter the ritual arena and simultaneously receive offerings.
The water god and the various spirits of the streams, rivers, oceans, and great seas, as well as the multitudes of dragons,
All come to enter the altar and receive offerings at the same time.
The Fire God, together with the various fire spirits and the assembly of vidyadhara sages,
All come to enter the altar and receive offerings at the same time.
The Wind God, together with the various wind spirits and the formless circulating spirits,
All come to enter the altar and receive offerings at the same time.
The God Isana, together with the various Mara assemblies,
All come to enter this altar and receive offerings at the same time.
The God Indra, together with all the gods and ghosts included in the various Sumeru mountains,
All come to enter the altar and receive offerings at the same time.
The Yama God, together with the various officials of the five paths, the Lord of the Tai Shan Prefecture, the Director of Life and Destiny, the plague-causing spirits, and the hungry ghosts,
All come to enter the altar and receive offerings at the same time.
The Brahma God, together with all the gods of the form realm and the various heavens of meditative absorption,

The moon god and the twenty-eight constellations that abide in the sky, the twelve palace deities, and all the multitudes of constellations,
All come to enter the altar and simultaneously accept offerings.
One should contemplate in this way.
Thus the lord of the gods personally faced the Buddha and
vowed to bear the responsibility for all sentient beings, to uphold the state boundaries, and to guard the true Dharma.
If one summons them, they will not violate their original vow and will certainly respond.
As long as they have not been dismissed,
they will abide in the altar and not disobey the practitioner.
Therefore, after summoning and making offerings, one should then express gratitude.
One should be lax in all matters and beg for their delight.
When summoning, use the individual mudras and mantras.
Or using the general invitation mudrÄ and mantra is also acceptable.
What are the few offerings?
The various celestial beings and spirits each obtain enjoyment.
It is said that due to the three meanings of few offerings, all enjoy.
First, by the empowerment of the three secrets.
It means to offer the mind of the Dharma realm and the wonderful truth.
Second, by great compassion.
Third, because those celestial lords have much merit and virtue.
Just as a dragon obtains a little water and, by its own merit and virtue, sprinkles it throughout the various countries.
The mantra is the reason why the four continents are filled with the merit of humans.
It is not as good as the merit and wealth of one person in the heaven of the four heavenly kings.
According to the master's will, there is increase and decrease.
But because the celestial beings have much merit and virtue,
They can lack few offerings and give them to all.
It is like a small fire that increases and decreases according to the fuel.
Few offerings are also like this.
Because the celestial beings have much merit and virtue, they are able to make them vast.
Moreover, even if the color and taste are inferior,
Because of the three meanings above, they all become pure and subtle ghee.

The worldly realm is still like this.

and give rise to great compassion to perform the three secrets empowerment?
Moreover, due to the heavenly blessings, those inferior offerings
become pure and subtle offerings, like the man who obtained a stone becoming a king.
The woman who took sand as gold.
The assembly of beautiful women did not indulge in worldly wealth, but only delighted in following the truth.
Therefore, they did not despise small offerings, but joyfully gave with compassion.
If the heavens are not pleased, then invite the lord of the outer vajra division, the four-armed immovable wrathful vidya-raja, to make offerings and take refuge.
At that time, the heavens will follow the teachings and joyfully protect and uphold them.

Samantabhadra Bodhisattva, in order to deliver sentient beings,
Asked himself questions and answered himself, with such causes and conditions.
Such acts of repaying kindness, such prayers,
Such contemplation of the Dharma, such three secrets,
Such skillful means, such great power,
Expounded as he wished and offered to the World-Honored One.
The World-Honored One said, The principles are like this.
Excellent, excellent! As you have said, it is true and not false.
These twelve devas were the buddhas of the past.
They came and manifested in order to deliver sentient beings.
Therefore, practitioners should not rely on the devas of form and appearance.
Only contemplate the adornments of the Dharma body of those devas.
If people follow what I and you have said,
